H0.text: Bone marrow is the softer connective tissue that fills the interior of most bone.

H1.text: Solid marrow is the softer connective tissue that fills the interior of most bone.

H2.text: Liquid marrow is the softer connective tissue that fills the interior of most bone.

H3.text: Attached marrow is the softer connective tissue that fills the interior of most bone.

A4.text: Bone marrow is a semi-solid tissue found within the spongy (also known as cancellous) portions of bones.

A5.text: In adult humans, bone marrow is primarily located in the ribs, vertebrae, sternum, and bones of the pelvis.
